intro: Symbolanthus sessilis, commonly known as the sessile symbolanthus, is a flowering plant native to parts of Africa and the Arabian Peninsula. It is a member of the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its simple, alternate leaves and showy, five-petaled flowers that are typically pink or white. It thrives in arid and semi-arid environments, often growing in rocky or sandy soils. Symbolanthus sessilis is often cultivated for its ornamental value and is also used in traditional medicine in some regions.
